snippet: Federal Reserve officials believe the bank could do more to increase the pace of inflation and aid growth. They simply are not persuaded that the benefits outweigh potential costs.
abstract: Labor Department reports that unemployment rose to 7.9 percent in January, up from 7.8 percent in December 2012, latest evidence of country's slow economic recovery; some economists suggest data indicates the Federal Reserve is not doing enough to combat inflation.
lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials believe the bank could do more to increase the pace of inflation and aid growth. They simply are not persuaded that the benefits outweigh potential costs.

headline.seo: As Growth Lags, Some Press the Fed to Do Still More
headline.main: As U.S. Growth Lags, Some Press the Fed to Do Still More
headline.print_headline: As Growth Lags, Some Press Fed To Do Still More
